quotes.message: Emancipation of women has made them lose their mystery.
quotes.name: Grace Kelly

quotes.message: Emancipation from error is the condition of real knowledge.
quotes.name: Henri Frederic Amiel

quotes.message: Emancipation from the bondage of the soil is no freedom for the tree.
quotes.name: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.message: The emancipation of man is the emancipation of labor and the emancipation of labor is the freeing of that basic majority of workers who are yellow, brown and black.
quotes.name: W. E. B. Du Bois

quotes.message: True emancipation begins neither at the polls nor in the courts. It begins in woman's soul.
quotes.name: Emma Goldman

quotes.message: Every emancipation has in it the seeds of a new slavery, and every truth easily becomes a lie.
quotes.name: I. F. Stone

quotes.message: Emancipation is the demand of civilization. That is a principle; everything else is an intrigue.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: Every emancipation is a restoration of the human world and of human relationships to a man himself.
quotes.name: Karl Marx

quotes.message: Emancipation of belief is the most formidable of the tasks of reform and the one on which all else depends.
quotes.name: John Kenneth Galbraith

quotes.message: We shall never secure emancipation from the tyranny of the white oppressor until we have achieved it in our own souls.
quotes.name: W. E. B. Du Bois

quotes.message: We boast our emancipation from many superstitions; but if we have broken any idols, it is through a transfer of idolatry.
quotes.name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.message: The history of men's opposition to women's emancipation is more interesting perhaps than the story of that emancipation itself.
quotes.name: Virginia Woolf

quotes.message: The progression of emancipation of any class usually, if not always, takes place through the efforts of individuals of that class.
quotes.name: Harriet Martineau

quotes.message: What we call emancipation is always and of necessity simply the free choice of the soul between one set of limitations and another.
quotes.name: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quotes.message: Emancipation of human nature inevitably brings with it scientific and technological progress.
quotes.name: Liu Cixin

quotes.message: For me emancipation will only be truly reached if a woman can wear makeup and skirts without having her abilities doubted as a result.
quotes.name: Kristina Schroder

quotes.message: The emancipation of woman will only be possible when woman can take part in production on a large, social scale, and domestic work no longer claims anything but an insignificant amount of her time.
quotes.name: Friedrich Engels

quotes.message: Emancipation, to be of any value to the slave, must be the free, voluntary act of the master, performed from a conviction of its propriety.
quotes.name: Elijah Parish Lovejoy

quotes.message: The first effect of emancipation from the Church was not to make men think rationally, but to open their minds to every sort of antique nonsense.
quotes.name: Bertrand Russell

quotes.message: The emancipation of women is practically the greatest egoistic movement of the nineteenth century, and the most intense affirmation of the right of the self that history has yet seen.
quotes.name: Ellen Key

quotes.message: Merely external emancipation has made of the modern woman an artificial being. Now, woman is confronted with the necessity of emancipating herself from emancipation, if she really desires to be free.
quotes.name: Emma Goldman

quotes.message: Our emancipation means standing up for strong families, our emancipation means standing against the homosexuality agenda, emancipation for us means standing up against the repealing of the buggery law.
quotes.name: Alvin Bailey

quotes.message: True emancipation... will have to do away with the absurd notion of the dualism of the sexes, or that man and woman represent two antagonistic worlds.
quotes.name: Emma Goldman

quotes.message: The best way to stimulate emancipation is to start to educate your sons to be humans instead of men, and to educate your daughters to be humans instead of women.
quotes.name: Annie M.G. Schmidt

quotes.message: Emancipation of mind is the greatest liberty.
quotes.name: Lailah Gifty Akita

quotes.message: Emancipation can only come from within; it cannot be dictated by someone else. A law banning the wearing of headscarves changes nothing, except perhaps external appearance. Naturally, Islamic feminism must also include the right to education, to work and the freedom to select one's own husband.
quotes.name: Tariq Ramadan

quotes.message: Emancipation should make it possible for woman to be human in the truest sense. Everything within her that craves assertion and activity should reach its fullest expression; all artificial barriers should be broken, and the road towards greater freedom cleared of every trace of centuries of submission and slavery.
quotes.name: Emma Goldman

quotes.message: Emancipation was a proclamation, but not a fact.
quotes.name: Lyndon B. Johnson

quotes.message: For souls in growth, great quarrels are great emancipations.
quotes.name: Logan Pearsall Smith

quotes.message: Women's history is the primary tool for women's emancipation.
quotes.name: Gerda Lerner
